aphorisms.text: A politician needs the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month, and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn`t happen.

aphorisms.text: Old age is the most unexpected of things that can happen to a man.

aphorisms.text: Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom.

aphorisms.text: Any nation that thinks more of its ease and comfort than its freedom will soon lose its freedom; and the ironical thing about it is that it will lose its ease and comfort too.

aphorisms.text: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.

aphorisms.text: Man in general, if reduced to himself, is too wicked to be free.

aphorisms.text: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.

aphorisms.text: Familiarity breeds contempt.

aphorisms.text: It`s so easy to love. The only hard thing is to be loved.

aphorisms.text: The surest way of making a dupe is to let your victim suppose you are his.

aphorisms.text: Despair is a narcotic. It lulls the mind into indifference.

aphorisms.text: Man`s best possession is a sympathetic wife.

aphorisms.text: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.

aphorisms.text: We pardon familiar vices.

aphorisms.text: Respect is greater at a distance.

aphorisms.text: There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought.

aphorisms.text: Friendship is an art of keeping distance while love is an art of intimacy.

aphorisms.text: I cannot give advice in the matters of marriage and religion. I do not want people to suffer because of me.

aphorisms.text: It is better to be unhappy and know the worst, than to be happy in a fool`s paradise.

aphorisms.text: Everyone needs help from everyone.

aphorisms.text: A fashionable building will lose its youth in ten years and become obsolete. It will become less unpleasant to the eye in two hundred years when fashion is forgotten.

aphorisms.text: Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired, but by controlling the desire.

aphorisms.text: History is the science of what never happens twice.

aphorisms.text: Justice is to be found only in the imagination.

aphorisms.text: Wisdom is the strength of the weak.

aphorisms.text: Ability is nothing without opportunity.

aphorisms.text: When a man has once loved a woman he will do anything for her except continue to love her.

aphorisms.text: If some persons died, and others did not die, death would be a terrible affliction.

aphorisms.text: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets the more interested he is in her.

aphorisms.text: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.

aphorisms.text: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.

aphorisms.text: An honest man is always a child.

aphorisms.text: A book is a mirror: if an ass peers into it, you can`t expect an apostle to look out.

aphorisms.text: Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to.

aphorisms.text: What you do for money you do badly.
